rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1:
'''Necrophilia''' is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a sexual attraction to [[corpse]]s. This has been a charactistic of several [[serial killer]]s, notably [[Ed Gein]], though it is very rare even in that context. There have been numerous cases of necrophiles working in the [[funeral]] business, as it provides them with easy access to corpses.
'''Necrophilia''' is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a sexual attraction to [[corpse]]s. This has been a charactistic of several [[serial killer]]s, notably [[Ed Gein]], though it is very rare even in that context. There have been numerous cases of necrophiles working in the [[funeral]] business, as it provides them with easy access to corpses.
â
In [[California]], there were laws against mutilating a corpse or digging it out of a grave, but not against having sex with it. However, this changed on [[September 10]], [[2004]], when [[Governor of California|Govenor]] [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] signed a bill making necrophilic acts a felony punishable by up to eight years in prison. [http://www.sfexaminer.com/article/index.cfm/i/042204n_charges][http://www.reuters.com/newsArticle.jhtml?type=domesticNews&storyID=6208717]
+
In [[California]], there were laws against mutilating a corpse or digging it out of a grave, but not against having sex with it. However, this changed on [[September 10]], [[2004]], when [[Governor of California|Governor]] [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] signed a bill making necrophilic acts a felony punishable by up to eight years in prison. [http://www.sfexaminer.com/article/index.cfm/i/042204n_charges][http://www.reuters.com/newsArticle.jhtml?type=domesticNews&storyID=6208717]
In [[Colorado]] it might be covered by the [[misdemeanor]] "treats the body or remains of any person in a way that would outrage normal family sensibilities" (Colorado Statutes/Title 18 Criminal Code/Article 13 Miscellaneous Offenses/18-13-101. Abuse Of A Corpse).
In [[Colorado]] it might be covered by the [[misdemeanor]] "treats the body or remains of any person in a way that would outrage normal family sensibilities" (Colorado Statutes/Title 18 Criminal Code/Article 13 Miscellaneous Offenses/18-13-101. Abuse Of A Corpse).
